moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4 exd4 3. c3 dxc3 4. Bc4 cx: I sacrificed two pawns for development. This position is called Danish gambit Collijn defence.
moves.5... Nf6: Out of books, in Danish gambit Collijn defence next move for black is Qe7. But in my games I often came to this position.
moves.6. Qf3 Be7 7. e5: I take new approach. Normally I don't play whit my Q so early in the game, but here my bishop's are very dangerous, so I advance whit my e pawn.
moves.7... d5: Best move for black. So I think.
moves.11... Qe5 12. Nbc3: Now watch my knights, they are starting their cooperation.
moves.12... c6 13. Bb3 Be6 14. Bxe6 Qxe6 15. O: Time to take my king to safety and unpinning my knight.
moves.15... Nd7 16. Rfe1 O-O-O: Clever to take King to safety.
moves.17. Nd4: Let's make some attaks on his Q.
moves.18... Ne5 19. Qh3: Moving away from knight attack on f3 and hoping to get discovered check when I move my f5 knight.
moves.20... Nd3 21. Nfd6: I move my f5 knight, because whit e4 knight I'm also attacking f6 pawn.
moves.25... Qf6 26. Rab1 b6 27. a4 Kc7 28. Qg3: Again my Q is prepared for discovered check.
moves.28... Kd8: Here I saw some combinations, so next moves are pretty much forced.
moves.29. Nb7+ Kc8 30. Rxd7 Kxd7 31. Rd1+ Kc8: My two beautiful knights still working in pair.
moves.33... Kc8 34. Nxf6 Kxb7: And her one of my knights is gone. RIP you were very useful.
moves.35. Rd7+: And from here on mate was unavoidable.
Thank you for watching, and thanks to my opponent who didn't resign. Have a nice day!
